items.summary: Update backend pond membership storage and logic so joining/leaving a pond uses Froggy Phrase hash identity (userId: Text) end-to-end, without requiring a userId→Principal lookup (userIdLinkage) and without relying on caller Principal for membership.

Ensure backend join/leave pond operations correctly update the user profile’s joinedPonds list for the phrase-hash identity (userIdUserProfiles / getUserProfileByPhraseHash), creating a default profile if none exists for that userId, and never failing due to missing linkage records.

Implement a conditional Motoko state migration (backend/migration.mo) if required by the membership storage change, so existing deployed state upgrades safely and existing ponds remain readable after upgrade.

Update frontend join/leave pond flows (React Query hooks and any UI components that surface join errors) so that after the backend fix, joining/leaving works without showing the previous 'user id not found' failure, and the UI refreshes membership-dependent queries correctly.
